meanings.definition: Unable to be resolved or settled.
meanings.sent1: The conflict between the two countries was irresoluble.
meanings.sent2: The mystery of the missing key remained irresoluble.
meanings.sent3: The debate over who should do the dishes was irresoluble.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was as irresoluble as a knot that cannot be untied.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of loneliness was as irresoluble as trying to catch a shadow.

meanings.sent1: The substance formed an irresoluble residue at the bottom of the beaker.
meanings.sent2: The sugar crystals were irresoluble in the cold water.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn stain on the shirt seemed irresoluble to any detergent.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as irresoluble as oil and water.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air was as irresoluble as salt in water.

meanings.definition: Not able to be solved or explained.
meanings.sent1: The paradox presented an irresoluble dilemma for the philosophers.
meanings.sent2: The strange occurrences in the town were irresoluble by logic.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fascination with the laser pointer was irresoluble to the owner.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of human emotions is as irresoluble as a never-ending maze.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was as irresoluble as the colors blending in the sky.
